texts: the democrat wave in 2025 and the return of the yellow dog democrat well that was a depressing election day wasnt it the big three plus two 2025 elections have all been tabulated and the democrats won bigly new jersey governor in new jersey the democrats won a yuge race for governor democrat rep mikie sherrill nj11 despite being a terrible candidate according to normal candidate metrics beat republican jack ciattarelli 563 percent to 432 percent my prediction was totally off here as i assumed that the republican nominee would win a narrow majority or plurality in this race democrats broke a historical trend going back to 1961 despite the unpopularity of the sitting democrat new jersey governor and his poor management of taxes and energy policies so why did this unprecedented event happen there appear to be three distinct possibilities 1 florida gov ron desantis claimed that jack ciattarelli would have won four years ago and he would have won tonight if you just take all the republicans whove left new jersey since ive been governor and they moved to florida 2 i reached out to one of my little birds in new jersey a prominent conservative pollster and he argued that ciattarelli had no message and that he could not define what change is just being for change is not enough it allows your opponent to define what the change is but keep in mind when a campaign loses it is frequently blamed on the lack of a message 3 political guru ryan girdusky blamed yuge democrat turnout in the end ciattarelli received 122000 more votes than he got in 2021 more votes than gov phil murphy d received when he won reelection that year but it wasnt enough because sherrill received about 450k more votes than murphy and only 400k less than kamala received it is also possible that the results were some combination of the three feel free to pick your poison

the man who stole 45 billion partied with leonardo dicaprio and vanished into china let me tell you about the night britney spears jumped out of a cake to wish happy birthday to a man whod stolen billions of dollars from an entire country it was november 2012 las vegas a nightclub so exclusive you needed to be on a very specific guest list to even know it existed and there surrounded by hollywood alisters supermodels and the children of oil sheiks was jho low a softspoken slightly pudgy malaysian man who nobody had heard of five years earlier celebrating his 31st birthday while britney spears literally emerged from a giant cake singing to him leonardo dicaprio was there paris hilton was there kim kardashian was there they were all there because jho low had paid them to be there with money hed stolen from malaysias sovereign wealth fund while pretending to be developing his country and heres the thing that makes this story so perfectly darkly absurd at that exact moment jho low was financing a martin scorsese film called the wolf of wall street a movie about a corrupt stockbroker who steals millions and hides the money in foreign banks this is the story of how a nobody from malaysia became the worlds most successful financial criminal threw the most expensive parties in human history bought his way into hollywood and then disappeared into china where hes reportedly living under a fake identity as a greekaustralian businessman while working as a secret advisor to the chinese government and the craziest part is most of the money is still missing but lets start at the beginning the poor rich kid heres what you need to understand about jho low he wasnt poor his grandfather had built an empire in ironore mining liquor and real estate across thailand malaysia and hong kong his father sold a textile company for 15 million by any normal standard jho low was born into serious wealth but he wasnt born into enough wealth and that psychological wound that sense of being rich but not rich enough is what created the monster when jho lows parents sent him to harrow school in london the same boarding school that educated winston churchill and seven british prime ministers he found himself surrounded by kids whose families made his family look middleclass saudi princes children of russian oligarchs heirs to billiondollar fortunes that had existed for centuries and jho low the son of a successful malaysian textile manufacturer was suddenly at the bottom of the wealth hierarchy he had money but he was surrounded by people with unfathomable money money so vast it had its own gravity money that opened doors he couldnt even see thats where it started not in poverty not in desperation in relative deprivation in the psychological torture of being wealthy enough to see into the world of the superelite but not wealthy enough to truly belong there so he decided to steal his way in learning to buy people after harrow jho low made a calculated decision he didnt go to cambridge or oxford like most harrow graduates he went to wharton the university of pennsylvanias business school not because he cared about the education spoiler he never actually graduated but because wharton was where the worlds richest young people went to pretend they cared about learning business and jho low didnt go to wharton to study he went to wharton to network his classmates included the children of gulf princes saudi oil sheiks and heirs to multinational corporations and jho low softspoken awkward with women not particularly charismatic figured out something brilliant he couldnt compete with these people on inherited wealth or social pedigree but he could compete on throwing parties so thats what he did he rented out nightclubs in philadelphia spent tens of thousands of dollars per event made sure the guest lists included all the right people for his 20th birthday he dropped 40000 to rent shampoo one of philadelphias hottest clubs he invited ivanka trump on gambling trips to atlantic city he became obsessed with paris hilton and reportedly watched house of wax her movie over and over again he was buying his way into social circles he couldnt organically access and it worked because heres what jho low understood that most people dont rich people really rich people are deeply profoundly bored and the person who can cure that boredom who can make things happen who can get the best clubs and the best celebrities and the most exclusive experiences becomes valuable jho low made himself valuable not through talent or charm or intelligence through money specifically through spending more money than anyone else was willing to spend on making rich kids have fun and through those parties he met the people who would later help him steal billions he met riza aziz who happened to be the stepson of najib razak malaysias future prime minister he met yousef al otaiba a foreign policy advisor to uae sheikhs who introduced him to khaldoon khalifa al mubarak who ran mubadala development a sovereign wealth fund managing billions these werent random friendships these were strategic acquisitions jho low was collecting powerful people the way some people collect stamps and he was doing it by throwing the best parties anyone had ever seen the first lie heres a detail thats easy to miss but absolutely critical jho low never actually graduated from wharton he dropped out but for the rest of his career when meeting with bankers when pitching deals when building his reputation as an international financier he told everyone he had a wharton degree when joanna yu a relationship manager at ambank in malaysia first met jho low she believed hed graduated from wharton because low had provided her with a letter stating exactly that years later when lows lawyer revealed that low had never actually graduated yu was genuinely shocked this wasnt just resume padding this was the foundational lie that made everything else possible because when youre trying to convince people to give you access to billions of dollars wharton graduate carries weight it signals legitimacy intelligence connections it opens doors jho low understood that credentials arent about what you actually accomplished theyre about what people believe you accomplished and if you lie convincingly enough if you provide the right documentation if you never hesitate if you act like its obviously true people wont question it nobody checked nobody verified a missing diploma became a wharton education through the simple mechanism of saying it enough times that it became true the art of the namedrop after leaving wharton dropout status carefully concealed jho low returned to malaysia with a new identity international financier with connections to the worlds wealthiest families according to joanna yu who managed lows accounts at ambank lows conversational style was distinctive he would constantly mention that he was going to meet somebody from kuwait or reference conversations with the governor of bank negara malaysia or the prime minister of malaysia or prince turki alsaud of saudi arabia these werent casual mentions they were strategic deployments even if the conversations hadnt happened even if low had simply been in the same room as these people at some event the repetition created an aura of access think about how this works psychologically if someone mentions once that they know a prince you might be sceptical but if that same person casually references conversations with princes prime ministers governors and sheikhs across dozens of interactions your brain starts accepting it as background reality the sheer volume of namedropping becomes its own evidence jho low wasnt just lying he was constructing a persona through accumulation each tiny lie reinforced the previous lies until the whole structure felt solid enough to support billions of dollars in fraud 2009 the big score begins now we get to the actual crime and its important to understand that what jho low did was not a simple theft it was architecture he built elaborate financial structures specifically designed to make stealing look like investing in 2009 malaysias new prime minister najib razak whose stepson youll remember jho low had befriended at wharton created something called 1malaysia development berhad 1mdb for short it was supposed to be a sovereign wealth fund that would invest in development projects and make malaysia rich najib invited jho low to become involved as an advisor and thats when low saw his opportunity the petrosaudi scam august 2009 a yacht in monaco najib and low are meeting with representatives from petrosaudi international an oil drilling company theyre discussing a joint venture 1mdb would invest 1 billion into a partnership with petrosaudi acquiring 40 equity in a new company called 1mdb petrosaudi limited on paper it looked legitimate malaysias sovereign wealth fund partnering with an oil company to develop energy resources exactly the kind of thing sovereign wealth funds are supposed to do but heres what actually happened on september 30 2009 when that 1 billion was transferred 300 million went to the legitimate joint venture account at jpmorgan 700 million went to an account at rbs coutts bank in zurich belonging to a shell company called good star limited and who owned good star limited jho low personally when the banks compliance team asked who owned good star 1mdbs ceo falsely claimed it was owned by petrosaudi but it wasnt it was jho lows personal account hed just stolen 700 million in a single transaction by creating a fake company with a name that sounded official enough that nobody checked low didnt just wire money from 1mdb to himself he created corporate structures joint ventures investment agreements loan documents he made the theft look like business and business is so complicated involves so many parties and documents and jurisdictions that unravelling it requires forensic accountants working for years between may and october 2011 good star received another 330 million in transfers each one disguised as legitimate business transactions by the end low had personally stolen over 1 billion from malaysias sovereign wealth fund and almost nobody knew it was happening the goldman sachs connection by 2012 jho low had refined his operation he wasnt content stealing hundreds of millions he wanted billions and to do that he needed goldman sachs goldman sachs one of the most prestigious investment banks on earth with compliance systems and risk management and all the institutional safeguards designed to prevent exactly this kind of fraud agreed to underwrite three massive bond offerings for 1mdb between 2012 and 2013 total raised 65 billion goldmans fees nearly 600 million heres how it worked according to former goldman banker tim leissner who was later convicted and sentenced to prison for his role in 2012 jho low convened a meeting in his london apartment where he explicitly outlined which malaysian and uae officials would receive bribes to ensure goldman was selected as 1mdbs underwriter it wasnt subtle it wasnt hidden low literally explained the bribery structure to goldman bankers and they proceeded with the deal anyway billions from those bond offerings were then systematically diverted into offshore shell companies controlled by low and his associates the bonds were supposed to fund malaysian development projects power plants real estate infrastructure instead the money flowed through a web of shell companies in switzerland singapore and the cayman islands ultimately ending up in accounts low could access from just one of those bond transactions prosecutors allege low stole 14 billion goldman sachs eventually paid a 29 billion settlement to malaysia one of the largest wall street penalties in history but the settlement allowed goldman to avoid admitting wrongdoing which raises the obvious question how complicit was goldman sachs as an institution were leissner and roger ng another goldman banker who was convicted just rogue actors or did goldmans corporate culture enable the fraud we will probably never get a definitive answer but what we know for certain is that one of the worlds most sophisticated financial institutions facilitated the theft of billions of dollars and jho low made it possible by understanding something fundamental if you bribe the right people and make the paperwork complicated enough even goldman sachs will look the other way what did he do with 45 billion now heres where the story shifts from financial crime to pure unhinged excess because jho low didnt steal billions to hide them in swiss bank accounts and live quietly he stole billions to throw the most expensive parties in human history and buy his way into hollywood the leonardo dicaprio friendship jho low met leonardo dicaprio at a las vegas party in 2010 and what began as a casual acquaintance rapidly evolved into something much weirder low became dicaprios financier party sponsor and giftgiverinchief low financed massive parties in las vegas los angeles and on yachts in the mediterranean he invited alist celebrities alicia keys paris hilton britney spears kanye west kim kardashian he paid emily ratajkowski 25000 just to attend the super bowl with him he donated millions to dicaprios environmental foundation and he gave dicaprio absurdly expensive gifts a 32 million picasso painting a first edition of the great gatsby an academy award statuette that marlon brando won for on the waterfront think about what that last gift means low somehow acquired one of hollywoods most sacred objects an actual oscar won by one of historys greatest actors and gave it to dicaprio like it was a novelty item the federal government eventually seized it along with the picasso and the gatsby but the gesture reveals everything about lows psychology he was using stolen money to buy proximity to fame and proximity to fame as proof that hed finally transcended his origins the wolf of wall street this is where the story achieves perfect ironic symmetry through his connection with riza aziz the malaysian prime ministers stepson low cofounded red granite pictures and used embezzled 1mdb funds to finance hollywood films the most infamous martin scorseses 2013 film the wolf of wall street starring leonardo dicaprio the film is about jordan belfort a corrupt stockbroker who steals millions through securities fraud and attempts to hide his illgotten gains in foreign safe havens sound familiar according to court documents a 9 million advance was made to red granite for the wolf of wall street in september 2012 paid directly from accounts controlled by jho low using stolen 1mdb money and as a final flourish of audacity low personally thanked himself in the films closing credits he stole billions from malaysia used that money to finance a movie about stealing money and hiding it offshore and then thanked himself publicly for financing the movie while federal investigators were already beginning to trace his fraud the department of justice eventually seized royalties from three red granite productions the wolf of wall street daddys home and dumb and dumber to but by then the damage was done low had successfully purchased a place in hollywood history and the fact that hed done it with stolen money almost made the achievement more impressive to the people whod spent time with him the yacht the gambling the jewellery lets talk about the 250 million superyacht in 2014 low took delivery of the equanimity a 300foot floating palace with a gym an olympicsized swimming pool a private art gallery a beauty salon a helipad and sleeping quarters for 22 guests the running costs were approximately 500000 per month just to maintain when malaysian authorities finally seized it in 2018 and tried to auction it off to recover stolen funds they could only get 130 million 52 of its purchase price because even among billionaires there are only so many people willing to buy a yacht thats internationally famous as the product of massive financial fraud then there was the gambling court testimony from the venetian casino in las vegas revealed that low gambled approximately 87 million there over the years losing 26 million one particularly bad session saw him lose 175 million in 90 minutes playing baccarat casino executives described him as extremely extravagant making requests parallel to none including custom disco balls dance floors and dedicated djs and the jewellery low purchased a 129 million heartshaped diamond for model miranda kerr along with a 38 million diamond pendant she was eventually forced to surrender both to federal authorities he bought art by picasso warhol and monet worth collectively 35 million all of it eventually seized by governments trying to recover the stolen billions heres whats psychologically fascinating jho low wasnt hiding his wealth most criminals who steal billions try to hide the money live quietly avoid attention low did the opposite he threw parties that made international news he hung out with the most famous people on earth he bought yachts that appeared in magazines its like he needed the world to see that hed finally made it that he was no longer the kid at harrow who wasnt quite wealthy enough that hed transcended his origins through sheer force of spending and that compulsive display is exactly what allowed investigators to trace where the money went the political bribery heres a detail that got buried in all the yacht and dicaprio coverage according to court testimony jho low attempted to donate upwards of 30 million to barack obamas 2012 reelection campaign think about that a malaysian national attempting to illegally funnel tens of millions of stolen dollars into an american presidential campaign the donation never went through for campaign finance laws but the attempt reveals the scope of lows ambitions he wasnt content buying celebrities and yachts he wanted to buy political power he wanted access to the president of the united states and he believed probably correctly that enough money could get him that access 2015 when everything started falling apart by mid2015 investigative journalists had started publishing stories about 1mdbs irregularities malaysian whistleblowers were coming forward the wall street journal published detailed reports about money flowing from 1mdb into prime minister najibs personal bank accounts the entire scheme was unravelling and jho low recognizing that his time was running out made a decision that separates him from most whitecollar criminals he ran not quietly not subtly he just left first to taiwan no extradition treaty with malaysia or the us then to macau perfect for a highrolling gambler who needed to hide and eventually according to investigative journalists to mainland china in july 2018 malaysian police confirmed low had fled macau for mainland china and thats where the trail goes cold sort of the shanghai mystery in july 2025 almost a decade after fleeing malaysia investigative journalists bradley hope and tom wright who wrote the definitive book on the 1mdb scandal claimed in a livestream that theyd found jho low according to their investigation low is currently living in shanghais exclusive green hills neighbourhood under a fake identity constantinos achilles veis using a forged australian passport even more provocatively they claim low is now operating as a behindthescenes strategist for the chinese government helping sanctioned chinese companies navigate global regulatory challenges let that sink in the man who stole 45 billion from malaysia threw parties with britney spears and leo dicaprio financed the wolf of wall street and became one of historys most wanted fugitives is allegedly now working for the chinese government under a fake greekaustralian identity malaysian authorities responded by saying they have no solid evidence to verify these claims australias department of foreign affairs confirmed that passport fraud carries penalties of up to 10 years imprisonment but said they couldnt comment on individual cases so as of now in 2025 we have credible investigative journalists claiming they know exactly where jho low is and what hes doing but no government has been able to confirm it or do anything about it the questions lets talk about what we dont know because the gaps in this story are almost as interesting as what we do know wheres the rest of the money malaysia has recovered approximately 74 billion in assets sounds like a lot until you realize that at least 13 billion remains completely unaccounted for low spent maybe a billion on yachts parties jewellery gambling and real estate that leaves billions that nobody can find does low have it hidden in accounts that havent been discovered did he transfer it to people we dont know about is it sitting in chinese banks under names nobodys connected to him yet we dont know prime minister mahathir mohamad said in 2019 that evidence suggests jho low kept a lot of the 1mdb money for himself but tracking it has proven impossible its out there somewhere billions of dollars just missing why is china protecting him if the reports are true and low is living openly in shanghai working for the chinese government the obvious question is why several theories 1 low is providing valuable services to china helping sanctioned companies maybe providing intelligence about western financial systems 2 china is using low as leverage against malaysia give us what we want or well never return your fugitive 3 low has hidden chinese government money in his network of accounts and china needs him alive and cooperative to access it 4 china simply doesnt care about malaysian or american law and enjoys thumbing its nose at western justice systems we dont know which is true probably some combination but whats clear is that if low is in china hes not there by accident china doesnt let internationally wanted fugitives accused of stealing billions just wander around shanghai unless theres a reason was najib razak the mastermind or the dupe najib razak the former prime minister of malaysia is currently serving a 12year prison sentence for corruption related to 1mdb but heres whats weird najib claims his relationship with jho low has been exaggerated and that other people 1mdb ceo shahrol halmi general counsel jasmine loo and ambank manager joanna yu were actually closer to low najib sarcastically noted that yu made jho low soup when he was unwell whereas i never prepared any meals for jho low is this just a politician trying to minimize his guilt probably but theres a legitimate question about who was actually running the scheme low had the connections the financial expertise the elaborate network of shell companies najib had the political power to make it possible who was manipulating whom and heres the thing that makes you wonder najib is in prison low is allegedly living in luxury in shanghai if they were equal partners in the crime thats some seriously unequal justice what happened to all the other conspirators tim leissner the goldman sachs banker got sentenced to prison roger ng another goldman banker got 10 years some malaysian officials got prosecuted goldman sachs paid billions in fines but what about all the other people who had to have been involved the lawyers who set up shell companies the bankers who processed transactions that they must have known were suspicious the accountants who signed off on fraudulent financial statements the politicians beyond najib who took bribes hundreds of people had to have been involved in enabling a fraud this massive most of them have never been identified let alone prosecuted why did he do it jho low was already rich his family had money he had connections he could have lived a comfortable legitimate life as a malaysian businessman or investor instead he orchestrated one of historys largest financial frauds knowing that if caught hed spend decades in prison or become a permanent fugitive why the simple answer is greed but i dont think thats the whole story because lows spending wasnt rational he wasnt accumulating wealth to secure his future he was burning through billions as fast as he could steal them throwing parties buying yachts gambling millions giving away picassos he was trying to prove something to the rich kids at harrow whod looked down on him to the wharton classmates whose families made his family look middleclass to himself and he achieved that for about five years jho low was exactly that person he was legendary people talked about his parties the way they talk about studio 54 or the playboy mansion he was the most interesting person in any room he entered not because of his personality by all accounts he was quiet and awkward but because of his willingness to spend whatever it took to create unforgettable experiences the moral of this extremely immoral story if theres a lesson in the jho low saga its probably this the global financial system is shockingly easy to manipulate if you have the right connections the right documentation and the willingness to lie convincingly you can steal billions from a sovereign wealth fund with goldman sachs facilitating the transactions and throw parties with leonardo dicaprio and finance hollywood movies about financial fraud and live in luxury for years before anyone figures out what youve done

politics yap session dont read when trump first ran i voted against him when he was elected i chose to believe this was a fluke glitch in the system or a timeline shift in other words something that wasnt meant to happen many people even trump voters felt the same way because it was a very highly unlikely event within context of the time over the five years 20162021 we watched our media institutions degrade into a contest over who can bash trump the hardest and fear monger the american public the most to raise ratings the truth is our media was long gone years before then but due to someone being in power that was unpredictable at the time made corporate sponsors uneasy 1st term synopsis trump was a lame duck for most of his term sent a few bombs and upheld the status quo for the most part messed up with the handling of c19 towards the end of his term of course biden was then elected and absolutely nothing changed the country kept getting more expensive and inflation skyrocketed legacy media tries to convince the public the president is capable to lead the country unsuccessfully the american public elects trump again as the white knight to reignite a fading star obviously trump is a showman and doesnt know the first thing about economic policy trumps prowess is in performance and so he goes through the motions deports thousands enlarges the debt helps israel as per usual and stirs up tensions with china my point is hes just an accelerationist who has his foot slammed on the pedal and has just unscrewed the nitrous nozzle hes speeding the country towards the truth whatever it may hold demise biden wouldnt have done a thing differently in his shoes perhaps let more illegal migrants in but that doesnt make a difference in the grand scheme of things does it the scourge of america is the national deficit and politicians will never stop dancing around it they wont get elected if they talk about regulating spending increasing taxation and taking accountability theyll get a lot more votes by claiming immigrants and discriminating against trans people is the biggest threat they want to prop up the stock market and make as many billions as they can before jumping ship and moving to dubai india when the water level reaches their chin so trump isnt the bad guy hes spending 3 trillion to try and give us and his billionaire friends the best 20 years of our life more so the billionaires before its all blown away to kingdom come trump is actually the best president for us because he has experience going bankrupt like 5 times lol

maga media praise trumps tariffs and trade deal with japan that hurt the us auto industry published 072525 226 pm edt written by zachary pleat president donald trumps maga media allies are celebrating his administrations tariff policies and new framework for trade with japan even as reporting shows theyre putting us automakers at a severe disadvantage and costing them billions in profits oaicitation0media matters in march 2024 trump warned of a bloodbath for the us auto industry if he wasnt elected which now appears to be happening under his own policies one of his campaign pledges was to boost the us auto industry with new tariffs on imported vehicles and components at the centre of his plan oaicitation1media matters but multiple news organisations recently revealed that trumps tariffs are hitting us automakers hard for example general motors said its profit in the second quarter fell by more than a third after trumps tariffs cost the company more than 1 billion oaicitation2media matters stellantis reported a loss of 23 billion 27 billion in the first half of the year partly because of tariffs and other republican policies oaicitation3media matters the revealed trade framework with japan has also raised eyebrows according to publicly available terms japanese automakers can import cars and parts at a 15 tariff rate lower than what many us automakers face for vehicles built in north america with high us content under trumps 25 tariffs oaicitation4media matters despite this magaaligned media are applauding the deal examples fox news host laura ingraham declared i love tariffs hosting commerce secretary howard lutnick to hype trumps trade deals oaicitation5media matters fox business host dagen mcdowell said she loves the fact that the us auto industry was upset by the japanese deal oaicitation6media matters host brian kilmeade suggested the deal will benefit us automakers if im working for chevy ill be able to see my cars sold in japan for the first time oaicitation7media matters former fox business host trish regan tweeted so good why its another huge win for usa about the japan deal oaicitation8media matters in short while the trade deal and tariffs may appear like wins in headlines the fine print suggests us automakers and by extension us auto workers might be the ones paying the price think again newsrewind

the coming fake national emergency max flugrath joins sam osterhout on election day sam osterhout and max flugrath of fair fight action lay out how the right is weaponizing every lever of power to erode democracy what begins as election integrity talk has evolved into federal overreach midcycle gerrymandering and coordinated propaganda designed to justify voter suppression the dojs move to seize georgia ballots is one piece of a broader strategy to manipulate outcomes ahead of 2026 laying the groundwork for permanent minority rule its the logical end of a long campaign to turn skepticism into submission convincing voters that democracy itself no longer functions tune in to this urgent conversation with sam osterhout and max flugrath

rightleaning podcasters call out the trump administrations 2016 election claims as a distraction from jeffrey epstein published 072825 546 pm edt written by noah dowe reed mcmaster following weeks of outrage from rightwing media over the jeffrey epstein files tulsi gabbard director of national intelligence recently declassified multiple documents relating to russian interference in the 2016 election arguing they prove a treasonous conspiracy to interfere with the results by the obama administration mediamattersorg but still thats probably why they did it hosts of rightleaning online shows many of which helped propel donald trumps campaign are calling the administrations election2024andepsteinrelated messaging a distraction they argue the focus on the 2016 election documents is designed to keep the trump base from paying attention to epstein theres no question that tulsi gabbard has brought on this obama scandal to appease the trump base and hope that they stop paying attention to epstein andrew klavan the daily wire i think its a distraction vincent oshana pbd podcast the commentary marks an unusual reversal in the maga ecosystem instead of singing trumps praises some major podcasters are openly critiquing his strategy and suggesting the base is being misled think again newsrewind

idea for an alternative to snap selffunding food security cards i was reading about the original orangeblue food stamp system in the 1930s40s before it shifted into meanstested welfare it worked more like a marketstabilization instrument people bought orange stamps and automatically got blue stamps that could only be used on surplus foods basically countercyclical household liquidity aligned with supply gluts it struck me how close that is to modern payroll benefit infrastructure transit cards pto accrual etc mechanism sketch worker elects payroll deduction orange balance automatically earns bonus credits blue blue only redeemable for items in surplus that week based on public ag data blue treated as taxable income when redeemed like pto value blue could also be cappeddonated between cardholders not meanstested not redistributive more like earned parametric grocery stability nudges consumption toward surplus reduces waste buffers household volatility avoids welfare cliffs it feels like this should already exist as a boring employerbenefit product but i cant find a modern implementation curious where the blocker is tax code banking rails misaligned incentives political path dependence nobody bothered because snap exists feels like theres an alternate universe where this became as normal as commuter cards could also work as a freestanding product offered by banks and credit unions only with 1099s instead of w2s or even the dmv or idnyc why it has the potential to be selffunding public or private underwriters make money off the float when people add money to the card government can charge administrative fees for access to the necessary apis and data feeds recovery of funds through income taxes as described above not welfare a closed system to help the system run more efficiently empowering consumers with a financial product

ppp in total disarray no renewal no message no direction the korea times political analysts predict ppps crushing defeat in next years local elections unless drastic reforms are made the main opposition people power party ppp is slipping deeper into political turmoil caught between hardline supporters and a widening public backlash since the martial law crisis late last year under thenpresident yoon suk yeol of the ppp political observers say the countrys main conservative party has yet to show any signs of reform it has instead relied on boycotts of parliamentary sessions and government events along with inflammatory rhetoric and internal feuds that have alienated moderate voters the partys boycott of president lee jae myungs policy speech its declaration of total war against the administration and a series of verbal gaffes by senior members have reinforced its image as combative but purposeless even during last months parliamentary audit the ppp failed to mount a single effective challenge fueling perceptions that the opposition has lost its political edge entirely todays ppp can hardly be called a healthy opposition political commentator park sangbyoung said the party is paralyzed by a selfserving system dominated by entrenched interests in the southeastern strongholds of busan daegu and north gyeongsang province where nomination virtually guarantees election that structure prevents any real change park added that the partys leadership has become a machine of survival rather than conviction focused on protecting internal power rather than offering alternatives to the current administration the ppp is neither an ideological nor a policydriven party anymore it has turned into a network of selfpreservation he said another political analyst hwang taesoon shared a similar view arguing that the party has lost its direction under the leadership of chairman jang donghyeok who remains tied to farright loyalists favoring confrontation over compromise an opposition should offer ideas and unity not just slogans and outrage hwang said under the banner of endless resistance the ppp has become captive to its own hardcore base without moderate conservatives it ceases to be a real opposition hwang warned that next years local elections could see a repeat of the partys crushing defeat in 2018 when it lost nearly all metropolitan seats besides those in daegu and north gyeongsang province if nothing changes the ppp faces electoral extinction beyond its regional strongholds he said the public will deliver its own verdict before the party can fix itself inside the party few seem willing to confront the problem park noted that most lawmakers remain complacent believing that as long as they secure their nominations they will keep their seats predicting that only a major defeat can break the partys patronage system he described the upcoming local elections as the last opportunity for political cleansing hwang also described the upcoming vote as a moment of reckoning for korean conservatism this should be a healing process for the right he said without a sense of remorse and renewal the ppp will remain a party of the past a recent poll highlights the crisis according to a gallup korea survey conducted from tuesday to thursday on 1002 adults nationwide 40 percent of the respondents said they support the ruling democratic party of korea dpk while 26 percent supported the ppp and another 24 percent expressed no party preference compared with the previous week dpk support slipped 1 percentage point while the ppps rating remained unchanged analysts say the numbers confirm that the ppps confrontational tactics are eroding its support base the party is stuck in the rhetoric of punishing the government rather than defining its own values park said unless it resets its message and leadership the next election could mark a breaking point for koreas conservative movement the survey had a margin of error of plus or minus 31 percentage points at a 95 percent confidence level details of the polls methodology and results are available on the website of the national election survey kerala government medical college doctors to go on strike on november 13 over unmet demands doctors working in keralas government medical colleges have announced a oneday statewide strike on november 13 2025 to protest against longpending issues that the state government has failed to resolve the protest organized by the kerala government medical college teachers association kgmcta will see doctors suspending all nonemergency services including outpatient consultations elective surgeries and academic duties however emergency departments icus and casualty services will continue to function as usual the strike comes after months of appeals and repeated representations to the state government regarding pay revision delays and staff shortages according to kgmcta the salary anomalies from the 2016 pay revision remain unresolved and the government has not addressed disparities in the pay structure particularly for entrylevel doctors and assistant professors the association also demanded the creation of new teaching and nonteaching posts to match the increasing patient load in medical colleges and hospitals doctors have also voiced concerns about the governments policy of redeploying existing faculty to new medical colleges instead of recruiting new staff claiming it strains both institutions and affects the quality of medical education and patient care additionally kgmcta has urged authorities to improve infrastructure provide adequate facilities and ensure better working conditions for medical professionals the association stated that this strike is a symbolic protest to draw attention to their longstanding grievances if the government continues to ignore their demands kgmcta warned it might escalate to an indefinite strike patients visiting government medical colleges on november 13 are advised to plan accordingly as most outpatient and routine medical services will remain suspended for the day the doctors hope this action will push the state to initiate meaningful discussions and implement longoverdue reforms in the healthcare and education sectors

the handling of issues like the russiaukraine war tariffs us strikes on iran immigration enforcement and most of all disclosures in the epstein case the president spent last week failing to tamp down discussion of the epstein story that seemed to be fracturing the maga movement he tried claiming that his political enemies had written the epstein files argued that the epstein case is pretty boring stuff and even lashed out at supporters who talk about it as weaklings and stupid people but while the propagandists at fox news were willing to play ball trumps statements backfired elsewhere leaving many rightwing media figures and the base alike in a state of revolt on thursday however the wall street journal reported that a bawdy letter bearing trumps signature had been included in an album created for epsteins 50th birthday before allegations of his sexual abuse of girls became publicly known the document according to the journal had been reviewed by justice department officials who handled epsteins case the journal report could have focused the rights attention on trumps voluminous ties to epstein but trump redirected them at a familiar target journalists he responded that night by calling the paper fake denouncing the paper and claiming that he would sue the following day he followed through with a defamation lawsuit seeking 10 billion in damages from the two authors of the article the journals publisher dow jones co parent company news corp and that companys ceo and murdoch himself trumps lawsuit is both unprecedented and consistent with trumps authoritarian treatment of a free press whose criticism he seeks to curtail through corrupt means the message it sends is straightforward if you publish reporting that displeases the president even if like murdoch your support was crucial to his political ascension he may try to ruin you so dont try it while the journals corporate cousins at fox news mostly avoided the story on friday the networks competitors throughout the fractured marketplace of rightwing media responded by sharpening their knives and attacking the paper laura loomer deemed the journal story totally fake charlie kirk accused the journal of a terrible driveby and benny johnson claimed that the real scandal is in who wrote the story referencing a baroque conspiracy theory that was circulating on the right at the time the same day trumps lawyers filed their suit former fox contributor and current director of national intelligence tulsi gabbard offered even more grist for the rightwing media mill in a story served up to fox as an exclusive gabbard claimed to have uncovered documents proving a treasonous conspiracy in 2016 committed by officials at the highest level of our government which aimed to subvert the will of the american people and enact what was essentially a yearslong coup she suggested that figures including obama must be investigated and prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law and said she was referring the documents to the justice department leaving nothing to subtext trump subsequently posted to truth social an ai video featuring obama being arrested and imprisoned those documents however demonstrate nothing other than gabbards own ignorance andor malice they show that obama received an intelligence report that russia had not hacked election systems to change vote totals in the 2016 election which is consistent with what the obama administration said publicly at the time then asked for and subsequently received another intelligence report detailing other actions taken by the russian government in an effort to influence the election that effort according to the intelligence community the justice department and a senate committee helmed at the time by current secretary of state marco rubio included hacking and releasing democratic emails fox news contributor andrew mccarthy in a withering piece at national review described gabbards argument as a frivolous attempt to further trumps foolish stance that russia had not tried to influence the 2016 election via overwrought and misleading language and thundering claptrap but her attacks served to reignite years of conspiracymongering about the russia witch hunt and thus were credibly regurgitated elsewhere on the right including by foxs stars with some echoing gabbards demagogic language about purported treason trump meanwhile repeatedly posted fox clips and articles from rightwing media hyping the purported scandal much of maga media seems eager to target the journal and obama on trumps behalf but it remains to be seen whether those influencers or their audience will be willing to allow the epstein story to fade away altogether that said trumps best hope of keeping his supporters happy may very well be increasing the scale and tempo of his authoritarian attacks and that means there will be more to come in the months ahead think again newsrewind

opinion seattle needs on year elections this low turnout goes against our voter process and lowers participation its a little arduous and wed have to go through the current process at least one more time but civically i think its worth it stage 1 state law change required washington state law currently mandates municipal elections occur in oddnumbered years so the legislature must first authorize cities to hold elections in evennumbered years house bill 1339 introduced in the 2025 legislative session would provide this authorizationnwprogressive 2 legislative progress hb 1339 passed the house state government tribal relations committee on february 4 2025 and the appropriations committee on february 20 2025 but as of march 19 2025 it was returned to the rules committee for second reading the bill would make evenyear elections optional for local jurisdictions with odd years remaining the default unless cities choose to switch stage 2 local charter amendment once state law permits the change seattle must amend its city charter through one of two methods city council proposal the seattle city council can adopt a resolution proposing a charter amendment and submit it to voters this requires a majority vote of the council to place the amendment on the ballot stage 3 probably odd year voter approval the charter amendment requires approval by a simple majority of voters at the next general municipal election the amendment must be published in the citys largest circulation newspaper once weekly for four weeks before the election the last part would be a little tough on future candidates because theyd have to agree to a three year bridge term meaning they get one less year on their term but i think its good to try to campaign on it for future races and get better turnout

why is support for socialism growing recent survey data reveal that support for socialism is increasing in the united states this may be surprising given that socialism is a muchcriticized economic system that has failed spectacularly everywhere it has been tried the mounting support for socialism reflects a growing frustration with capitalism and the economic woes of an increasing proportion of the population that believes it has been left behind the election of democratic socialist zohran mamdani as mayor of a city that is home to wall street is sobering this pied piper of economic illiteracy has been swept into office by a majority of voters that have grown so disillusioned with the status quo that they see the mirage of economic prosperity in the false promises of socialism we ignore this development at our own peril there are three primary factors that collectively explain the growing support for socialism in the us first wealth has become increasingly concentrated at the top second while the distribution of wealth is highly skewed the distribution of votes across the electorate is not third the myth that refuses to die is that wealth can be redistributed without significantly reducing its size

surgical abortion 6 weeks experience firstly thank you to every person on here for sharing your experience i read so so many before i went through this i had my surgical abortion yesterday in johannesburg south africa im very very fortunate to have accessed the healthcare i did and the private hospital i was able to go to sharing details of my experience for anyone else tuesday went to disa clinic for blood tests and sonar scan to make sure it wasnt twins or ectopic i think this is a first step if you dont really know what to do or what your choices are id done heaps of reading before so i already knew i wanted to do surgical r1000 consult my medical aid wont cover that but others might their website has lots of information written in a really friendly way if its useful to anyone she then referred me to a gynaecologist based on my situation but does referrals specific to peoples circumstances she was really kind i was crying she told me to keep whatsapping her etc really lovely and supportive wednesday appointment with gynae she was fine very matter of fact gets referrals from this clinic often did another sonar i did look at the screen but she told me i didnt have to because she didnt want it to make me feel worse it was just for her her receptionist and finance person were incredibly kind they brought me water and pepsi and helped me fill in forms and helped me with lots of admin explaining the process of the surgery etc etc the dr also said she was putting the procedure through as a miscarriage so that no matter what other doctors or medical aid treated me id get equal treatment regardless of their beliefs i thought that was kind i had to pay for this consultation and iud device out of pocket about 6k 2400 for sonar and drs fees 3k for iud some medical aids do cover this thursday yesterday went to the hospital had to be there around 6am admission more forms nurse checked me in asked lots of questions again medical history allergies etc my best friend drove me you cant drive home after the surgery around 800 i went in to the operating area was put under anaesthetic i also elected to put an iud in at the same time the whole procedure took 27 minutes and i was completely asleep and unaware of anything happening i was awake again and being monitored by the nurses for a bit then taken back to the ward for observation had to eat drink and use the bathroom before theyd discharge me i had some light cramping no worse than my normal period as i woke up and some light bleeding cramping got better throughout the day and become more like an awareness of my womb discharged around 1200 light cramping in the evening but very manageable with a hot water bottle very very light bleeding overnight and today friday i feel fine medical aid will cover the hospital and anaesthetist and 150 of the drs fee overall it was a lot of admin i felt frustrated by the multiple consultations i had to have the amount of times i had to fill the same info in in forms and the cost at times i was like have i made the wrong choice to opt for surgical this was because it felt like a big deal and was more expensive and very admin heavy afterwards i know surgical was the right choice for me everyone is different and has different experiences but i feel like i didnt have any kind of traumatic experience minimal pain minimal blood im very freaked out by blood and wounds im also quite anxious and i wanted to be around medical professionals in case of any complications vs at home freaking out over how much blood is normal vs too much etc its also now over and done and not prolonged ultimately the right decision will vary for you i dont regret my decision at all and really feel massive amounts of relief that its over and my body is mine again two of my friends have each had two abortions and have gone on to have 2 kids each i want children one day too but not now and not in these circumstances one of the doctors also told me that if someone is trying to force you to make a decision you dont want our law can have them put in jail this is your choice and its just about whats best for you i hope this is helpful to someone and im thinking of you all and sending you love x

fox glossed over grocery prices last month as trump kept falsely claiming that food costs were coming down published 110325 322 pm est written by zachary pleat research contributions from harrison ray fox news and fox business network spent just 1 hour and 23 minutes discussing high and rising grocery prices in the month of october as highprofile offyear elections approached the two networks relative lack of attention to the salient topic offering less than 1 minutes per day on average to rising food prices that affect every single american comes at a time when donald trump has repeatedly and falsely claimed grocery and food prices were supposedly decreasing during his second term in office fox aired little coverage of rising grocery prices focusing largely on the increasing costs of beef while trump spent the month in denial of increasing grocery prices during his second term fox news and its sister network fox business each spent on average less than 1 minutes per day covering this issue a review by media matters for america found that fox news and fox business spent a combined total of 1 hour and 23 minutes covering high grocery prices during the entire month of october much of foxs coverage of grocery prices mentioned the higher price of beef or the increased cost of cattle with 22 of 26 segments 85 about rising food prices touching on those issues dramatically rising beef prices have spurred trump to increase imports of argentinian beef which has sparked a backlash among trump supporters in rightwing media congress and the cattle industry this hyperfocus on beef ignores other grocery staples that trumps tariff and massdeportation policies are making more expensive and during this time fox even put a positive spin on rising grocery costs by celebrating higher sales of hamburger helper and expressing nostalgia about eating it in childhood the fox networks treatment of the topic this year stands in stark contrast to their relentless coverage of food and grocery costs prior to the 2024 election which were often negatively framed even when food inflation was declining relative to wage growth or staying flat trump falsely claimed grocery prices are down despite rising food costs over the past month trump has routinely said that grocery prices are way down a falsehood he repeated in at least 10 speeches and public remarks in october even as grocery inflation has increased some of his remarks october 29 at an apac event in south korea grocery prices are down october 28 at a dinner with japanese business leaders in tokyo groceries are down except for the uh beef october 22 in a bilateral meeting with natos mark rutte prices are way down groceries are down when trump was confronted with the fact of increasing grocery prices during a november 2 interview with cbs newss 60 minutes he flatly denied reality defiantly stating no youre wrong trumps administration also initially refused to release funds for the supplemental nutrition assistance program snap benefits for more than 40 million americans in november a move supported by fox two federal judges on october 31 ordered the administration to fund snap and the united states department of agriculture told a federal judge on november 3 it will use a contingency fund to pay out partial benefits this follows republicanimplemented cuts of nearly 20 to snap earlier in the year in their socalled big beautiful budget reconciliation bill methodology media matters searched transcripts in the snapstream video database for all original programming on fox business network and fox news channel for any of the terms food beef or supermarket or any variation of grocer within close proximity of any of the terms cost price dollar amount pay or spend and also within close proximity of any of the terms increase surge spike up skyrocket or more or any variation of high or rise from october 131 2025 we timed segments defined as instances when rising grocery prices were the stated topic of discussion or when we found significant discussion of higher food prices two or more speakers we also timed mentions single speaker and teasers anchor promoted segment about higher food prices and reviewed whether the increased price of beef or cost of cattle were mentioned all times rounded to the nearest minute think again newsrewind

under the leadership of bari weiss the free press climate change coverage mirrors that of rightwing media outlets like fox news published 110425 156 pm est written by allison fisher in early october paramount skydance bought the free press and hired its founder bari weiss as the editorinchief of cbs news a newly created position which will shape how the newsroom covers major stories which could include the climate crisis notably among the national broadcast networks cbs has led coverage of climate change for at least the past four years airing the most coverage the most climate scientist guest appearances and the most segments that discussed climate solutions as compared to abc and nbc but its role as network leader is already under threat reported by heated as part of a series of layoffs at the network the majority of the fiveperson team supporting cbs newss climate coverage were fired in the memo announcing the layoffs the new chief executive david ellison said he was phasing out roles that are no longer aligned with our evolving priorities and there are other changes that could compound this threat on october 24 it was reported that weiss was interested in poaching fox news anchor bret baier who has a troubling record on climate reporting to potentially helm the cbs evening news additional reporting suggests that she may also be interested in bringing on board another conservative voice cnn contributor scott jennings though weiss infrequently focused her contrarian opinions on climaterelated issues in her pieces for the new york times and on her podcast under her leadership as founder and editorinchief the free press has published a number of articles undermining climate science and promoting contrarian views that mirror commentary from rightwing media outlets like fox news the free press has undermined climate science on august 19 the free press reported on a widely criticized climate study from the department of energy through an interview with one of its authors steven koonin a climate contrarian who has appeared on several rightwing media programs including several appearances on fox news what about climate change is real thats one of the questions koonin was asked giving him space to misrepresent a united nations intergovernmental panel on climate change report that affirmed the link between climate change and extreme weather events in fact climate scientists have been able to estimate how much climate change affects any given extreme weather event for years notably researchers found that the heat wave that sent temperatures in the pacific northwest and canada into triple digits just six weeks before the release of the 2021 report would have been virtually impossible without global warming in january of this year the free press interviewed koonin to downplay the role of climate change in intensifying the la wildfires similar to rightwing media outlets like fox news the free press misleadingly suggested that thenpresident joe biden and many climate scientists claimed climate change was the cause of the fires rather than a contributing factor to the intensity of the blazes in 2023 the free press published one of its signature contrarian pieces titled i left out the full truth to get my climate change paper published by patrick t brown the author who works for breakthrough institute claims to have purposely limited his research paper showing warming temperatures increased the likelihood of wildfire growth in california in order to prove that articles in scientific journals were distorting the scientific process by focusing too narrowly on climate change as reported by the washington post the opinion piece quickly provoked backlash from scientists and the editor of nature herself the free press elevates contrarian and conservative voices to disparage climate activism and action in february of this year the free press published a piece by doomberg an independent publication focused on energy finance and geopolitics titled everybody freeze its the climate police which used a proposed policy in the city of ottawa limiting residents from using remote car starters to warm up their vehicles for more than one minute before driving and reporting that a washington democrat hopes to study the impact of medical anesthesia on climate change as proof that efforts to address climate change have gone too farand as a result caused a global popular revolt against climate action it is the kind of cherrypicked reporting fox news does to paint the climate movement as out of touch and radical and like with fox newss coverage it fails to either acknowledge the severity of the climate crisis or present the mainstream efforts to decarbonize the economy through policies like renewable energy deployment that are both popular and effective in march the free press published a story on the environmental protection agencys efforts to claw back 20 billion of congressionally appropriated climate funds titled a 20 billion slush fundpaid by you to progressive nonprofits the piece largely represents the position of epa administrator lee zeldin that the funds were somehow fraudulent it also pushes the fox news narrative that the funding is a slush fund for the left including democratic politicians that was rushed out the door before bidens term ended like gold bars tossed off the titanic but as the new york times reported the climate funds were not hastily approved as biden left office the funding was legally appropriated through the inflation reduction act passed by congress in 2022 and grants were awarded through established procedures with public announcements made months before the election additionally as the washington post also reported a lawyer for the epa staffer who appeared in the video has since said he was not referring to the 20 billion grant program the former employee had nothing to do with the evaluation and selection of the recipients said a former epa official briefed on the matter these facts were largely absent from the free press piece in 2024 the free press published a contrarian piece by a retired sustainability influencer who is also the socialmedia editor for the outlet i helped make standing rock go viral now i regret it the author lamented that as an early socialmedia influencer she presented the nativeamericanled protest against an oil pipeline as black and white or goodversusevil she claimed her opinion on the dakota access pipeline and fossil fuels changed after she began reading books and news sources that strayed from the progressive party line titles like unsettled by steven koonin apocalypse never by michael shellenberger and fossil future by alex epstein notably the titles that she cited and their authors koonin shellenberger and epstein frequently appear across rightwing media to downplay the climate crisis disparage renewable energy andor promote fossil fuel use similarly in 2023 a former extinction rebellion uk member penned a piece for the free press climate activism has a cult problem in which the author argued that the climateaction organisation known for controversial direct actions is run by a cult leader the piece was published at a time when rightwing media hostility against climate activists was at a fever pitch and some rightwing media personalities were cheering on calls for violence against climate groups conservative journalists like bret baier could undermine cbs leadership in climate coverage for at least the last four years cbs has led its broadcast counterparts in the volume of climate coverage in 2024 the network accounted for 50 of total broadcasttv news climate reporting 381 minutes of 771 minutes across all three national broadcast networks the network also led in the number of climate scientist guest appearances it aired and the number of segments it ran that discussed climate solutions meanwhile fox newss flagship special report anchored by bret baier has repeatedly softened or distorted the stakes of global warming and climate action from 2009 through may 2021 more than 87 of its climate segments contained misinformation or misleading narratives while americans may be changing how they consume the news legacy media and broadcast journalism at networks like cbs still matter as the entire media landscape still relies on traditional journalism as part of the beginning of the information food chain this includes how anchors report on extreme weather events climate action and scientific reports and findings if cbs under weiss approaches this reporting like the outlet she founded or like the anchor she seeks to poach the network will risk becoming another cog in the machinery of climate denial and delay think again newsrewind
